nodes.text: Last week I was in Nigeria which is home to one in 10 of the world's HIV positive population
there is a real danger of a generalised epidemic unless we take action now.
Asia and eastern Europe also face rapid increases

The number of infected people in that country is estimated to reach 15 million by 2010. Those figures will outstrip the current number of people who are HIV-positive in southern Africa where many people would agree that crisis point has already been reached.
We do not want the catastrophically levels to be reached

Yet it is still possible that if we collectively do the right things now we could avert the catastrophically high levels of infection that have been predicted thereby reducing the subsequent death rates
